text: What I did: If you create a "website page" from your template just refresh the preview link when you make changes by refreshing it. If you add content via VSCode and it uploads template changes you have to save that template and publish. Then create a new "website page" preview.
That's kind of what I'm doing. Good to know I'm on the right track. Also running into issues now with uploading folders.
using upload command and putting the portal number in, said it's successful, but see no 'fonts' folder in the directory tree on HubSpot
Not sure the Design Manager supports font files yet... I usually upload those to the file manager: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cms-cli#upload>
then the file manager will give you a public URL in the HubSpot UI
Ok, so I grab the url from the file manager and reference that in my code? Sorry I'm fresh fresh to husbpot, JS/React dev here.
They are here, should I be able to reference them and use them in a theme?
correct, if you open the folder and look at the individual files, you'll see this in the sidebar:
Ah ok, so in my files when I'm importing them with font face the src would be this path?
